item.title: The Clever D Block Initiative
item.description:
During the recent 700 MHz spectrum auction, a small frequency band known as D Block went unsold because it didn’t reach its reserve price. This is unfortunate because D Block was supposed to play a crucial role in establishing a nationwide public service network. This plan, which could serve as a model for other initiatives, deserves further consideration, especially in challenging economic times. The idea for D Block originated after the September 11, 2001, attacks, when communication breakdowns hampered rescue efforts...

item.title: Hey, Look, More Spectrum!
item.description:
Don’t worry if you missed out on the recent 700 MHz spectrum auction and aren’t interested in the remaining options. There will be more spectrum becoming available soon. This isn’t about the FCC finding unused frequencies; it’s about a secondary market emerging. NextWave Wireless, a company that had acquired licenses for a significant portion of the microwave spectrum, is now divesting those assets to focus on their hardware business. NextWave’s portfolio, encompassing 154 licenses in the AWS bands, 30 in the WCS band, and 22 in the EBS and BRS band, covers a substantial portion of the US population...

item.title: Bandwidth Without Usage Metering
item.description:
